intro: Alibertia tobagensis, commonly known as the Togabense copal tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a fragrant resin that has been traditionally used in incense and perfumery. Its growth habit is typically low and spreading, with woody stems and opposite leaf arrangement. Alibertia tobagensis thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or disturbed habitats.
